intro: Baissea thollonii, commonly known as the Madagascar star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Asphodelaceae and is characterized by its rosette growth habit and striking white or pale blue flowers. The plant features succulent, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water in its arid habitat. Baissea thollonii is often found in rocky areas and is adapted to the unique environmental conditions of its native region.
